questions.question: Energy is defined as the ability to do _______.
questions.explanation: Energy is the capacity to do work.

questions.question: The SI unit of energy is _______.
questions.explanation: Joule (J) is named after James Prescott Joule.

questions.question: The energy possessed by a moving body is called _______ energy.
questions.explanation: Kinetic energy is energy of motion.

questions.question: The energy stored due to position is called _______ energy.
questions.explanation: Potential energy is stored energy due to position or configuration.

questions.question: The formula for kinetic energy is KE = ½_______.
questions.explanation: Kinetic energy depends on mass and velocity squared.

questions.question: The formula for gravitational potential energy is PE = _______.
questions.explanation: PE = mass × gravity × height.

questions.question: The rate of doing work is called _______.
questions.explanation: Power = Work/Time.

questions.question: The SI unit of power is _______.
questions.explanation: Watt (W) is named after James Watt.

questions.question: Energy can neither be _______ nor destroyed.
questions.explanation: Law of conservation of energy.

questions.question: 1 kilowatt-hour equals _______ joules.
Coal, petroleum and natural gas are called _______ fuels.
questions.explanation: Fossil fuels were formed from ancient organisms.

questions.question: Solar energy is a _______ source of energy.
questions.explanation: Renewable sources are continuously replenished.

questions.question: When velocity doubles, kinetic energy becomes _______ times.
questions.explanation: KE ∝ v², so doubling v gives 4 times KE.

questions.question: The sum of kinetic and potential energy is called _______ energy.
questions.explanation: Mechanical energy = KE + PE.

questions.question: A generator converts mechanical energy to _______ energy.
questions.explanation: Generators use electromagnetic induction.

questions.question: The ultimate source of most energy on Earth is the _______.
questions.explanation: Most energy sources trace back to solar energy.

questions.question: 1 horsepower is approximately equal to _______ watts.
Energy stored in food and fuels is called _______ energy.
questions.explanation: Chemical energy is stored in molecular bonds.

questions.question: The energy stored in a stretched spring is _______ potential energy.
questions.explanation: Elastic PE is due to deformation.

questions.question: In a freely falling body, PE converts to _______.
questions.explanation: PE decreases as KE increases during fall.
